newsitem.title: USA: Ringer acquires Dexol Industries assets.
newsitem.headline: Ringer acquires Dexol Industries assets.

text.p: Ringer Corp said Tuesday it acquired the net assets of Dexol Industries Inc, a California-based manufacturer and marketer of pesticides for the homeowner market.

The purchase price was not disclosed, Ringer said, but included issuance of restricted Ringer common stock, an installment promissory note and an earnout payable with Ringer common stock if certain contingencies are met.
Ringer said it is continuing to identify and evaluate other potential acquisition opportunities.
Dexol products are sold nationwide under the Dexol and several private label brand names to retailers and major distributors.

"Dexol will not only provide Ringer with a higher sales base, but it will also provide complementary product lines, incremental distribution and a low cost manufacturing operation," said Stanley Goldberg, chairman, president and chief executive of Ringer.

"While our plans call for operating Dexol as a separate division, we believe our combined resources will also allow us to more effectively serve the marketplace and our common customer base," he said.
Ringer provides lawn and garden care products for the retail and commercial markets.
